Description: THIS EDA PLANNING INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY (CEDS) FOR THE REGION SERVED BY THE WESTERN NEVADA DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT, WHICH CONSISTS OF NINE COUNTIES AND SIX MUNICIPALITIES.  THE CEDS PROCESS IS DESIGNED TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS IN THE CREATION OF AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO DIVERSIFY AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

MID- WILLAMETTE VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS HAS QUALIFIED FOR A 3-YEAR MATCHING PLANNING GRANT TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY (CEDS) TO PROMOTE IN COLLABORATION WITH AREA PARTNERS, A GROWING RESILIENT, DIVERSE AND HEALTHY ECONOMIC IN THE REGION.

THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF THE COLVILLE RESERVATION HAS QUALIFIED FOR A 3-YEAR MATCHING PLANNING GRANT TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THEIR CEDS DOCUMENT. THIS WILL PROMOTE INTER-COLLABORATION WITH AREA PARTNERS, AS WELL AS TO GROW A RESILIENT AND DIVERSE ECONOMY WITHIN THE REGION.

THIS EDA PLANNING INVESTMENT SUPPORTS THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY (CEDS) FOR THE REGION SERVED BY THE TRI-COUNTY ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT, WHICH COMPRISES THE COUNTIES OF FERRY, PEND OREILLE, AND STEVENS.  THE CEDS PROCESS IS DESIGNED TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS IN THE CREATION OF AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO DIVERSIFY AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

THE INVESTMENT WILL FOCUS ON DEVELOPING THE TRIBE'S 5-YEAR COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY (CEDS), AND ANNUAL UPDATES TO REFLECT CHANGES IN COMMUNITY NEEDS, ECONOMIC CIRCUMSTANCES AND DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES; PLANNING OR IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS THAT BUILD ECONOMIC RESILIENCE TO AND LONG-TERM RECOVERY FROM ECONOMIC SHOCKS SUCH AS THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THAT SUPPORT ENTREPRENEURS AND START-UPS, NEW TECHNOLOGIES THAT ARE CREATING TECHNOLOGY DRIVEN BUSINESSES, AND ADDRESS CLIMATE CRISIS.

NORTHERN ARIZONA COG WILL UPDATE AND IMPLEMENT THE REGION'S COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY (CEDS), PROVIDE ECONOMIC AND BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE COMMUNITY, INCLUDING EDUCATION, TRAINING, AND MENTORING, AND SUPPORT REGIONAL AND LOCAL SOLUTIONS RELATED TO INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS. NACOG WILL CONTINUE TO ENGAGE IN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PARTNERSHIPS, WITH THE ARIZONA COMMERCE AUTHORITY, WORKFORCE INNOVATION & OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOIA), STATE & LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND THE COMMUNITY; THE DISTRICT WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT BROADBAND PLANNING, AID WITH NEW AND EXPANDING BUSINESSES IN THE REGION, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT PLANNING.  NACOG WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD AND STRENGTHEN TOURISM EFFORTS, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR APACHE COUNTY IN PROJECT DEVELOPMENT THAT WILL PRODUCE JOBS AND REDUCE DISTRESS.  NACOG WILL ALSO EXPLORE AND EXPAND ENERGY RESOURCES BY PROMOTING SOLAR, WIND AND ALTERNATIVE ENERGY GENERATION.

THE CEDS PROCESS WILL ENABLE THE DISTRICT TO FACILITATE COMPREHENSIVE PLANNING IN COMMUNITIES OF COCHISE, GREENLEE, GRAHAM, AND SANTA CRUZ COUNTIES. THE STRATEGY WILL IDENTIFY INFRASTRUCTURE FOR IMPROVEMENT AND ANALYZE LOCAL ECONOMIES; SEAGO WILL CONTINUE TO ENGAGE IN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PARTNERSHIPS, WITH THE ARIZONA COMMERCE AUTHORITY, WORKFORCE INNOVATION & OPPORTUNITY ACT (WIOIA), STATE & LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND THE COMMUNITY; THE DISTRICT WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT BROADBAND PLANNING, PROVIDE ASSISTANCE FOR NEW AND EXPANDING BUSINESSES IN THE REGION, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT PLANNING.

THE TRIBE WILL CONTINUE TO PROMOTE COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL ECONOMIC INITIATIVES; ESTABLISH AND MAINTAIN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PARTNERSHIPS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, SUPPORT EXISTING/NEW TRIBAL BUSINESSES, AND WORK WITH LOCAL, STATE, FEDERAL AGENCIES, PRIVATE PARTNERSHIPS, AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DISTRICTS TO INCREASE JOB CREATION.  THE CEDS PROCESS IS DESIGNED TO BRING TOGETHER THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTORS IN THE CREATION OF AN ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ROADMAP TO DIVERSIFY AND STRENGTHEN THE REGIONAL ECONOMY.

PURPOSE: THE PURPOSE OF THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AWARD IS TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY FOR THE INUPIAT COMMUNITY IN BARROW, ALASKA.

ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: DEVELOPMENT OF A COMPREHENSIVE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT STRATEGY FOR THE INUPIAT COMMUNITY OF THE ARCTIC SLOPE. FORM CEDS STAKEHOLDER COMMITTEE AND ESTABLISH GUIDING PRINCIPLES; RESEARCH AND STRENGTHS, WEAKNESSES, OPPORTUNITIES, AND THREATS (SWOT) IDENTIFICATION MEETINGS; COMMUNITY AND REGIONAL DEVELOPMENT PLANNING; WRITE AND COMMISSION THE CEDS DOCUMENT.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES: DOCUMENTATION OF REGIONAL ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT PLANNING THAT WILL HELP THE COMMUNITY POSITION ITSELF TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES: COMMUNITY MEMBERS, LOCAL BUSINESSES, GOVERNMENTAL ENTITIES

SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT DOES NOT INTEND TO MAKE SUBAWARDS.

THE PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INVOLVE NORTH SLOPE BOROUGH, WHICH IS LOCATED IN THE NORTHERN MOST PART OF ALASKA.
